title: Ford 8N Tractor and Implements | Building A Homestead In 7 Days

subtasks: Turning the fuel shut-off on and off.
Checking and refilling the tractor's battery.
Installing a battery disconnect switch for safety.
Starting the tractor and ensuring the gear is in neutral.
Working on the rear pin replacement and adjusting the safety.
Understanding and troubleshooting the transmission (high/low gear selector).
Converting the tractor to 12-volt electrical system.
Restoring and maintaining farm implements such as the disc harrow, plow, and back blade.

tasks.task: Clearing and maintaining the driveway using a backblade.
subtasks: Attaching and operating the backblade to move snow.
Clearing gravel from the driveway during snow removal.
Adjusting the pitch of the machine for proper hill formation.
Using the machine for weed control without chemicals.

tasks.task: Implementing safety measures when working with the tractor.
subtasks: Ensuring all moving parts have protective covers.
